content.question: The graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above. On which of the following open intervals is the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> concave down?

choices.label: <math alttext=" open parenthesis, negative 5, comma negative 3, close parenthesis " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 6, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>6</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 3, comma 1, close parenthesis " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 6 comma 8, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>8</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 1, comma 4, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mtext>4</mtext></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext=" open parenthesis, negative 5, comma negative 3, close parenthesis " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 6, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>6</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
